intro: Davilanthus huajuapanus, commonly known as the Huajuapan tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of red and pink. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
